marketNews.title: BYD Launches New Hybrid Vehicle, Risk for ASII
marketNews.content:
BYD announced the launch of a new plug-in hybrid (PHEV) vehicle equipped with the latest DM 5.0 technology, which the company claims achieves a fuel consumption of 2.9 liters per 100 km (equivalent to 34.5 km per liter), compared with the previous DM 4.0 version that consumes 3.8 liters per 100 km (26.3 km per liter). The DM 5.0 version is priced from 99.8 thousand yuan (approximately IDR 220 million), while the DM 4.0 version starts at 79.8 thousand yuan (approximately IDR 180 million). The price could be higher in Indonesia due to import duties and luxury vehicle tax (PPnBM).

There is currently no information on whether the PHEV DM 5.0 models (Qin L sedan and Seal 06 sedan) will be sold in Indonesia, as even the DM 4.0 models (Qin Plus DM-i sedan and Song Plus DM-i SUV) have not yet entered the Indonesian market. However, BYD officially entered Indonesia earlier this year and has purchased land in Subang, so the company could launch its PHEV models in Indonesia in the future, likely beginning with the DM 4.0 version.

At the IIMS 2024 exhibition, BYD’s products received a positive response, with the number of vehicle order letters (SPK) reaching more than 1,000 units (Toyota recorded 762 units and Wuling 799 units).

To date, BYD sells three battery-electric vehicle (BEV) models in Indonesia: the Dolphin SUV, the Atto 3 SUV and the Seal sedan, priced respectively from IDR 425 million, IDR 515 million and IDR 629 million.

The hybrid-vehicle segment in Indonesia is growing rapidly, with ASII holding a market-share of up to 72.5 % for FY 2023.

Key Takeaway: Because BYD’s hybrid models are priced considerably lower, their entry could negatively affect ASII’s hybrid market share. ASII’s hybrid models – the Innova Zenix Hybrid (fuel consumption 18.8 km per liter) and the Yaris Cross Hybrid (27 km per liter) – are priced higher, starting at IDR 430 million and IDR 367 million respectively. Hybrid vehicles contributed about 7 % of ASII’s total vehicle sales in FY 2023.

marketNews.title: IMF raises China 2024-2025 growth forecasts
marketNews.content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) raised its 2024 and 2025 China economic-growth forecasts to +5 % and +4.5 % respectively, an upward revision of 0.4 percentage points compared with the April 2024 projections. The upward shift is driven by strong Q1 2024 GDP data and policy measures taken by the Chinese government. The IMF, however, projects China’s growth to slow to only 3.3 % by 2029, constrained by an ageing population and a slowdown in productivity expansion.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg Intelligence: Indonesia thermal-coal price expected to stabilise in 2H 2024
marketNews.content: Bloomberg Intelligence analyst Kevin Ng said that domestic thermal-coal prices in Indonesia are likely to stabilise in the second half of 2024 after falling 58 % throughout 2023. Ng noted that strong demand from India should support prices, while any further price rise will depend on a decline in U.S. Federal Reserve rates and new stimulus in China.

marketNews.title: REN21 says global renewable-energy transition slowed in 2023
marketNews.content: The policy group REN21 reported that the global shift toward renewable energy slowed in 2023 due to regulatory gaps, political pressure and a failure to set clear targets. By the end of 2023, only 13 countries – including the United States, India and China – had adopted renewable-energy policies for buildings, industry, transport and agriculture, accounting for just 12.7 % of total energy consumption. Of the 69 countries that have end-user renewable-energy targets, only 17 have extended those targets beyond 2024.

marketNews.title: Indonesia prepares three new Special Economic Zones (KEK)
marketNews.content: The Indonesian government is preparing three new Special Economic Zones (KEK). The first is an integrated zone in BSD City developed by Bumi Serpong Damai (BSDE) with an estimated value of IDR 18.8 trillion and an estimated 13,446 jobs. The second is a hospital project in Batam valued at IDR 6.91 trillion with an estimated 105,406 jobs. The third is a smelter project in Morowali, led by Vale Indonesia (INCO), valued at IDR 135.38 trillion and expected to create about 136,000 direct and indirect jobs.

marketNews.title: Mazda Indonesia to build IDR 400 billion car assembly plant
marketNews.content: Mazda Indonesia’s Chief Operating Officer Ricky Thio said the company is committed to building a car-assembly plant worth IDR 400 billion, which will employ Indonesian engineers and workers.

tickerNews.title: MPMX declares 2023 dividend of IDR 115 per share, 11 % yield
tickerNews.content: $MPMX will distribute a 2023 dividend of IDR 502 billion, equivalent to IDR 115 per share, representing a 95.5 % dividend-payout ratio. The payout exceeds the analyst’s expectation of IDR 82 per share noted in the “Mini Unboxing MPMX” analysis. The dividend payment date will be announced on 28 June 2024. Using the Thursday (30 May) closing price of IDR 1,045 per share, the implied dividend yield is about 11 %.

tickerNews.title: PGAS announces 2023 dividend, implied 9 % yield
tickerNews.content: $PGAS will distribute a 2023 dividend of approximately US$222.5 million, or IDR 148.3 per share (using an exchange rate of IDR 16,160). The cum-date and payment date have not been announced. Using the Thursday (30 May) closing price of IDR 1,635 per share, the implied dividend yield is about 9 %.

tickerNews.title: PTRO secures US$240 million loan and US$170 million working-capital facility from BBCA
tickerNews.content: Petrosea signed a credit facility worth US$240 million and IDR 1.3 trillion with Bank Central Asia (BBCA). The facility has a tenor of 8–10 years and is intended to support business expansion and debt refinancing. In addition, Petrosea signed a working-capital facility of US$170 million from BBCA to fund EPC and mining operations.

tickerNews.title: MEDC declares final 2023 dividend of US$45 million
tickerNews.content: Medco Energi Internasional will distribute a final dividend for FY 2023 of about US$45 million, or roughly IDR 29.1 per share (using an exchange rate of IDR 16,160). The cum-date and payment date have not been announced. Using the Thursday (30 May) closing price of IDR 1,410 per share, the implied final dividend yield is about 2.1 %. Previously, MEDC paid an interim dividend of US$25 million in December 2023.

tickerNews.title: BSDE share purchase raises Paraga Artamida stake to 39.85 %
tickerNews.content: PT Paraga Artamida, the controlling shareholder of Bumi Serpong Damai (BSDE), bought approximately 17.1 million BSDE shares at an average price of IDR 949 per share between 21 May and 28 May 2024, for a total transaction value of about IDR 16.3 billion. After the transaction, PT Paraga Artamida’s ownership in BSDE increased from 39.77 % to 39.85 %.

tickerNews.title: KLBF signs partnership with Alliance Pharma to expand prescription-drug business in Thailand
tickerNews.content: Kalbe Farma, through its subsidiary Kalbe International Pte. Ltd., signed a cooperation agreement with Alliance Pharma Co. Ltd. to expand prescription-drug business in Thailand. Under the agreement, Kalbe International will acquire a 49 % stake in Alliance Pharma, with the transaction value not disclosed.
